revised_title: Observations on the Climate, Agriculture, and Natural History of Barbados
tldr: The author, Mr. Lister, shares observations from his correspondent in Barbados, discussing the island's climate, fertile soil, and plant life. He notes the prevalence of wells for fresh water, the construction of stone houses, and the dark blood of the local Negro population. The author also compares the effects of sun exposure on different people and creatures in various latitudes.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Climate
